column5: So I recent ripped apart my trolling motor and built a small control box so it sits beside me on the kayak.  This box will control the speed.   There are two wires that are a bit thicker gauge.  I can't seem to find the right gauge at the big box stores.   Anyone know where I can get wires in the Scarborough/Pickering area?  I temporarily used thinner gauge wires and it works but it's not reaching max speed so im guessing the thinner gauge is restricting max output.  Thanks.

Not knowing what size/amps your trolling motor takes, Princess Auto carries down to 8ga.  Also the option of getting a cheap set of jumper cables at Wallymart, take the ends off and there you go.  6ga would probably be more than enough.
Car audio shop for straight copper or West Marine if you want tinned marine wire.
Any Electrical supply house like Nedco (where I bought mine, wanted batteries at the back for my bow mount) or Ideal supply etc.  Michael
YUP ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Was going to be my reply as well.

Man Kayak fishing has come a long way since we would go out at the cottage in Uncle Lloyds home made Kayaks with one lure, the one on the rod and a small trout net. Fantastic, I even I think I can still get in and out of one, with an electric I would only need back up paddles. That I would love to try.
